abstracts.cdata!:
The Recovery and Rehabilitation Project
            will assist Eritrea to launch a program of urgent recovery
            and rehabilitation that will have important economic and
            social benefits and lay the basis of future economic growth.
            The project supports a package of interventions in the
            product sectors (agriculture and industry); infrastructure
            rehabilitation (roads, power, water supply and ports);
            community level activities (community fund); and
            institution/capacity building (implementation assistance,
            economic/finance management and urgent technical assistance
            to selective sectors).  It includes the following main
            components: (a) agricultural inputs, including a supply of
            seeds, fertilizers, insecticides/fungicides, hand tools,
            tractors and irrigation pumps; (b) livestock, including
            provision of veterinary drugs and vaccines, draft animals,
            and layers and boilers to restock the poultry industry; (c)
            industrial inputs, including provision of road maintenance
            equipment and tools; (e) power, including provision of spare
            and replacement parts for diesel generators, transmission
            line poles/cross arms, vehicles and office and communication
            equipment; (f) community rehabilitation fund to provide
            materials and equipment and civil works to support
            rehabilitation by local communities of basic social and
            economic infrastructure;   and (g) institution building to
            support project implementation, economic/financial
            management, and selected sectors through provision of
            technical assistance, training, vehicles, and equipment.
